ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course explored a wide array of topics related to the study of lithic technologies including but not limited to, cognitive development, social and political structure, trade and communication between ancient societies, and the analytical methods used to study stone tools. The class had workshops that engaged students in actual flint knapping, offering insight to the difficulties and challenges of the skill. This was helpful in developing an understanding of the type of analysis that can be done based on flake scars and debitage.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was very interesting and each class was focused around a theme which enabled a better understanding of the papers we read. Articles were designated to specific people to lead discussion which was useful in keeping conversations active and allowed for a more in depth look at each paper by specific people rather than a cursory look by everyone. The course could have possibly benefited from a bit more discussion on the basics of lithic analysis and studies as read about in the textbooks as this could have cleared up any confusion from those books and allowed for a more structured connection between each weekly topic.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I think this class was very interesting but especially niche. I would recommend it to archaeology or anthropology majors or anyone interested in the subject as there is a lot of information gained from the course.
